skill.name: agent-browser
skill.description: Automates browser sessions with inference.sh for navigation, element interaction, screenshots, and video capture in web workflows.
skill.summary: Agentic browser automation with session reuse and rich capture.
skill.author: inf-sh

security_audit.summary: Static findings mostly reflect documentation examples and shell templates for the infsh CLI. No evidence of malicious intent was found, but the skill documents cookie extraction and session storage access, which can expose sensitive data if misused.

medium_findings.title: Sensitive session data exposure in documentation
medium_findings.description: Documentation shows cookie extraction and lists session storage contents, which could expose authenticated data if misused.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: The examples explicitly show cookie extraction and session storage lists, but they are instructional and not executed by the skill.

medium_findings.title: Install command uses pipe to shell
medium_findings.description: The quick start instructs piping a remote install script to sh, which can be risky if the source is compromised.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: The command is explicitly shown, but it is a common install pattern and not executed by the skill itself.

low_findings.title: Shell command examples in templates
low_findings.description: Templates use command substitution and infsh CLI calls for local execution. They are expected usage patterns, not hidden execution.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Command substitution is present, but it is confined to user-run templates with explicit parameters.

low_findings.title: Path traversal strings are documentation links
low_findings.description: Relative paths such as ../SKILL.md appear in Markdown links and do not indicate filesystem access.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: The paths appear in Markdown references and are not used for file operations.

low_findings.title: Weak crypto and reconnaissance flags appear in text only
low_findings.description: The flagged lines are tables or comments with no cryptographic operations or system inspection commands.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Reviewed lines show descriptive text and JSON examples rather than crypto or system probing.

dangerous_patterns.title: Pipe to shell install command
dangerous_patterns.description: Uses curl piped to sh for installation, which can run unverified remote code.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: The pattern is explicitly present, but it is a documentation example and not automatically executed.

dangerous_patterns.title: Command substitution in shell templates
dangerous_patterns.description: Shell templates rely on command substitution to capture CLI output, which can be risky if variables are untrusted.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: The pattern exists, but it is standard in shell scripts and tied to user-controlled execution.

content.user_title: Automate web tasks with an agentic browser
content.value_statement: Manual browsing workflows are slow and error prone. This skill automates navigation, form entry, and capture so teams can repeat web tasks consistently.
actual_capabilities: Open URLs and return element refs for interaction
Interact with elements by ref for click, fill, drag, and upload
Take screenshots and record videos of sessions
Execute page JavaScript and return results
Reuse sessions for multi step workflows
limitations: Requires reachable URLs and valid site access
Refs must be refreshed after navigation or DOM changes
Does not bypass captchas or MFA without user input
Templates require the infsh CLI to be installed

use_cases.title: QA regression run
use_cases.description: QA engineers automate form submission and capture screenshots across environments.

use_cases.title: Data collection
use_cases.description: Data analysts gather structured information from web pages using repeatable flows.

use_cases.title: Support reproduction
use_cases.description: Customer support teams recreate a user issue and record a video for escalation.

prompt_templates.title: Open and list elements
prompt_templates.prompt: Open https://example.com and return element refs for the main content area and the primary action button.

prompt_templates.title: Fill a login form
prompt_templates.prompt: Open https://example.com/login, fill the email and password fields, submit the form, then resnapshot.

prompt_templates.title: Capture evidence
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to https://example.com/settings, take a full page screenshot, then close and return the video.

prompt_templates.title: Proxy and JavaScript check
prompt_templates.prompt: Open https://example.com using proxy http://proxy.example.com:8080, run JavaScript to count h2 tags, and report the count.

output_examples.input: Open a page and list element refs for the login form.
output_examples.output: Returned a session id and refs for email, password, and submit button.

output_examples.input: Record a session while navigating to the pricing page.
output: Screenshot captured at the pricing section

best_practices: Use environment variables for credentials and avoid hardcoding secrets
Resnapshot after navigation before reusing element refs
Close sessions to release resources and finalize recordings
anti_patterns: Embedding secrets in prompts or scripts
Running the curl install command without verifying the source

faq.question: Does the skill run a real browser or a headless browser?
faq.answer: It runs a Playwright based browser session through the inference.sh service.

faq.question: Can I automate logins that require MFA?
faq.answer: You can automate the steps, but MFA still requires user provided input or manual approval.

faq.question: How do I keep a session alive across steps?
faq.answer: Start with session new, reuse the session id for each call, and close it when finished.

faq.question: Is proxy support available?
faq.answer: Yes, you can pass a proxy URL and optional credentials in the open function input.

faq.question: What data can be captured from a page?
faq.answer: You can capture screenshots, videos, and JavaScript results such as text or counts.

faq.question: Do I need to install anything locally?
faq.answer: Templates assume the infsh CLI is installed and authenticated before running commands.
